intro: Cheiridopsis insignis, commonly known as the yellow snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent species is characterized by its compact growth habit and fleshy, blue-green leaves. It produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the warmer months. The plant is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves and stems to survive drought conditions.
